channel.title: MySQL Download?
channel.description:
[s]Just a quick question that I'm confused about. Which MySQL download do I download to run a RSPS with? I downloaded the Community Server version but it just installs a service and there's no GUI for importing or what-not. I have limited bandwidth which is why I don't want to just download them all. Thanks.[/s] I click on phpMyAdmin and
Welcome to phpMyAdmin Error MySQL said: #2002 - The server is not responding (or the local MySQL server's socket is not correctly configured) Connection for controluser as defined in your configuration failed.
My MySQL and Apache services are both running, I viewed the status link via Admin button on the XAMPP control panel and
MySQL database ACTIVATED PHP ACTIVATED HTTPS (SSL) ACTIVATED Common Gateway Interface (CGI) ACTIVATED Server Side Includes (SSI) ACTIVATED SMTP Service DEACTIVATED FTP Service DEACTIVATED Tomcat Service DEACTIVATED
Tomcat, wtf? and SMTP and FTP wtf too because any file transferring sevices are activated on my computer, so... I'm stuck.

@Mendorphins wrote:

Fixed, thanks everybody. My story of MySQL is scattered over about 3 topics lol. Anyway, this can either be locked or left to rot. Thank you for all your help.

item.title: MySQL Download?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:8, topic:385547”]On a clean install of mysql I believe that the ‘root’ account is created with no password. This is obviously very insecure so you will need to change it.

Assuming your server is running on the local computer.

shell> mysql -u root
mysql> SET PASSWORD FOR 'root'@'localhost' = PASSWORD('password');

http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/default-privileges.html[/quote]
K thanks, I managed to get on and import the SQL file, the server still does not recognise that I have done this though. I’ll have another fiddle and then start again from scratch if all else fails.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Download?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

On a clean install of mysql I believe that the ‘root’ account is created with no password. This is obviously very insecure so you will need to change it.

Assuming your server is running on the local computer.

shell> mysql -u root
mysql> SET PASSWORD FOR 'root'@'localhost' = PASSWORD('password');

http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/default-privileges.html

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Download?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Just did a search and my old topic popped up, lol. Coon, I have XAMPP installed, I went to phpMyAdmin and it says error 2002: MySQL was not configured.

So I need to install MySQL first right? Before using phpMyAdmin?

Here’s the version I downloaded but am having problems with. When I install it, it asks me for a current password… well I don’t have a current password. I just flipping installed it (almost installed it) and it fails to start te service. http://www.mysql.com/downloads/mysql/

Hope I explained a bit better. I hope a 2 week grave dig is acceptable. Also edited OP.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Download?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[s]Just a quick question that I’m confused about.

Which MySQL download do I download to run a RSPS with?

I downloaded the Community Server version but it just installs a service and there’s no GUI for importing or what-not.

I have limited bandwidth which is why I don’t want to just download them all.

Thanks.[/s]

I click on phpMyAdmin and

Welcome to phpMyAdmin

Error
MySQL said:

#2002 - The server is not responding (or the local MySQL server’s socket is not correctly configured)

Connection for controluser as defined in your configuration failed.


My MySQL and Apache services are both running, I viewed the status link via Admin button on the XAMPP control panel and
MySQL database ACTIVATED

PHP ACTIVATED

HTTPS (SSL) ACTIVATED

Common Gateway Interface (CGI) ACTIVATED

Server Side Includes (SSI) ACTIVATED

SMTP Service DEACTIVATED

FTP Service DEACTIVATED

Tomcat Service DEACTIVATED

Tomcat, wtf? and SMTP and FTP wtf too because any file transferring sevices are activated on my computer, so... I'm stuck.
